definition: to awaken/to wake sb up/to rouse
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)
to wake up/to be awake/to become aware/to sober up/to come to

sentences.chinese: 妮珂萊特叫醒吉諾曼姨媽。

sentences.english: Next morning the little man wakes the woman up.
sentences.chinese: 第二天小矮人把美女叫醒。

sentences.english: Theat the head of your bed has an automatic waking device.
sentences.chinese: 您牀頭的臺子裝有不傭人的勞力叫醒器。

sentences.english: Before long af armer woke him up.
sentences.chinese: 沒過多久，一個農夫叫醒了他。

sentences.english: She was afraid of oversleeping, so she asked someone to wake her up.
sentences.chinese: 她擔心睡過頭，於是請人叫醒她。

sentences.english: Please wake him up at six.
Reaching the number, he hurried up the steps and did not spare the bell in waking the servant.
sentences.chinese: 到了公寓，他急忙跨上臺階，照舊按鈴叫醒了女僕。

sentences.english: One Mexican family was rousted out of bed in the middle of the night and quarantined.
sentences.chinese: 一家墨西哥人，在半夜被叫醒，然後隔離。

sentences.english: Stoke the fire, break out the silver, wake the china.
sentences.chinese: 快生火，拿出銀器，叫醒瓷碟。

sentences.english: He woke his wife and ran out of the house carrying his mother who's more than 90.
sentences.chinese: 他叫醒妻子，揹着90多歲的老母親跑出了房子。

sentences.english: If I don't wake up in time, please call me.
sentences.chinese: 如果到時我沒醒，請叫醒我。

sentences.english: We offer free wake-up tea and Internet service.
sentences.chinese: 我們提供免費的叫醒早茶和網絡服務。

sentences.english: Night after night, however, I was woken up and told to move along by security guards or the police.
sentences.chinese: 但夜復一夜，我還是數次被保安或警察叫醒並趕走。

sentences.english: The construction of mending the sky had not finished yet, but people did not want to wake Nuwa up.
sentences.chinese: 人們不忍心叫醒女媧，但是補天的工作還沒有完成。

sentences.english: We have to shake him for a long while to rouse him from his sleep.
sentences.chinese: 我們得搖晃他半天才能把他叫醒。

definition: to wake sb up with a noise
to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
to wake up/to be awake/to become aware/to sober up/to come to
to get out of bed/to get up
to sleep soundly/to fall into a deep sleep
